thread.title: State colleges: Stanford swimmers leave Utah in their wake
thread.title_full: State colleges: Stanford swimmers leave Utah in their wake | The Salt Lake Tribune

title: State colleges: Stanford swimmers leave Utah in their wake
text:
Host Stanford defeated Utah in a Pac-12 swimming and diving meet on Friday, with the Cardinal men's team beating the Utes 164-125 and the women's team prevailing 177-112.
Utah's Bence Kiraly won the men's 1,000-yard freestyle in 9 minutes, 7.93 seconds. Swimming in the event for the first time this season, Kiraly set a Pac-12 season-best mark by almost three seconds. His teammate Jay Bolsinger was fifth in the event with a time of 9:37.80.
Kiraly also captured the 500 freestyle with the best time in the Pac-12 this season (4:25.76), and fellow Ute Peter Kotson placed fifth in 4:38.32.
 Utah's Paul Ungur won the 100 backstroke in 49.32 seconds.
In the women's competition, Utah's Petra Soininen won the 100 butterfly in 57.92 seconds, and teammate Darby Wayner placed second in 58.20.
Aggies blank Falcons
WOMEN'S SOCCER • In Logan, Jayne Robison and Jessica Brooksby scored for Utah State as the Aggies defeated Air Force 2-0 to improve to 8-7-1 overall and 3-4-0 in the Mountain West. Robison scored in the 28th minute off and assist from Katie Flynn, who rebounded her own corner kick before making the pass. Brooksby scored in the 68th minute. USU goalkeeper Jeannie Woller tallied seven saves to earn the shutout.
Utah Valley 3, Grand Canyon 1 • In Orem, Kasandra Anderson was first to get the Wolverines on the scoreboard as she received a cross from Kali Stubbs on the right side and sent it past the GCU keeper in the 12th minute. The goal is Anderson's fifth goal of the season. Taylor Kirk gave the Wolverines a 2-0 advantage in the 22nd minute as she received a lead pass from Stubbs and fired a shot with her left foot past the keeper. Jamie Brown added a goal in the 39th minute.
Idaho 4, Southern Utah 0 • In Moscow, Idaho, the first-place Vandals trounced the Wildcats in a Big Sky Conference game. Idaho led 1-0 at halftime before adding three goals in the second half. SUU goalkeeper Taylor Bolding made five saves, while Idaho's Amanda Poertner had five saves in earning the shutout.
Griffins fall
Men's SOCCER • Colorado State University-Pueblo defeated host Westminster 3-1, with Hunter Kone scoring for the Griffins in the 80th minute.
BYU 9th in Wisconsin
CROSS COUNTRY • No. 22 BYU placed ninth at the Wisconsin Adidas Invitational on Friday in Madison, paced by Natalie Shields-Connolly's 40th-place finish.
